oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mussel meal diets to growing/finishing pigs: influence on performance and carcass quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wallenbeck, A.
Neil, M
Lundeheim, N.
Andersson, K.H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Animal husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mussel meal has potential as an alternative protein source for pig since it has high portein content and a balanced Amino acid pattern. Mussels are good filterers of Water and an effective Tool to clean Waters from nitrogen and phosphorus. Using mussel meal as feedstuff in animal production could close the aro-aqua nutrient cycle, bringing nutrients back from the Water to the agro-ecosystem. Session 26 - Theatre 7.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Wallenbeck, A.; Neil, M; Lundeheim, N. and Andersson, K.H. (2014) Mussel meal diets to growing/finishing pigs: influence on performance and carcass quality. In: Book of Abstracts of the 65th Annual Meeting of the European Federation of Animal Science, p. 249.
